page.title: 18Birds & fish Craignish.
page.content: ..CONTINUED FROM PAGE 17.....Pochard, Razorbill, Redpoll(Lesser), Redshank, Redwing,Reed Warbler,Robin,Rook,Scaup, Scoter,Sedge Warbler,Shag,Song Thrush, Tree Sparrow,Starling,Swallow,Whooper Swan, Teal, Tree Creeper, Tufted Duck, Whitethroat, Wigeon, Woodcock, Wren. FISH ETC IN CRAIGNISH LOCH. Small SAITHE are to be found around the black rock (Sgeir Dubh) but the only large fish (some very large) present throughout the year are SKATE. SEA TROUT and an occasional SALMON come up the loch in June & July (foll- owed by seals). MACKEREL are now un- common but GREY MULLET appear in mid- summer & are especially concentrated in shallow water south of the church. Lobster & edible crab present through -out the year.Jellyfish abound some Summers.Occasionally a whale & basking shark (up to 30') have been seen.
